{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3682346,"name":"joel truher","username":"truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-16T19:48:30.545Z","cooked":"

hey, REV Vortex users (and @Greg_Needel) do you-all have any sort of guide to making shaft supports for the neo vortex cantilever? we’re using the integrated pinion (which i think is great), and the plan is to turn down the end of it to 8mm, to fit a 608. does that seem like a good thing to do?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-07-16T19:48:30.545Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":220,"readers_count":219,"score":49.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504334,"topic_slug":"neo-vortex-shaft-support","display_username":"joel truher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53190,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/neo-vortex-shaft-support/504334/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3682391,"name":"Brendan Simons, 5406","username":"nuclearnerd","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuclearnerd/{size}/7324_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-16T21:29:59.937Z","cooked":"

We used the 7 tooth pinion shafts for Vortex motors this year on our elevator gearbox in order to get a 12:1 reduction out of a single stage.

We did not support the far end of the shafts and had no issues, but I don’t see any problem with your plan to use an 8mm bearing either - as long as your lathe can cut the (hardened ?) steel gear teeth.

image1203×906 112 KB

oh, interesting. so maybe the shaft cantilever isn’t always an issue? i’m not sure what the failure mechanism actually is.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-07-16T22:55:14.455Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":166,"readers_count":165,"score":33.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":504334,"topic_slug":"neo-vortex-shaft-support","display_username":"joel truher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":22221,"username":"nuclearnerd","name":"Brendan Simons, 5406","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuclearnerd/{size}/7324_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53190,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/neo-vortex-shaft-support/504334/3","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3682895,"name":"Frank Lima","username":"franklima260","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/franklima260/{size}/4291_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-17T16:49:57.699Z","cooked":"

If you want additional support this portion of the gear is 13.75mm for standard FRC bearing.

image442×842 22.2 KB

We also now sell a 1" OD 13.75mm ID bearing for some alternative packaging opportunities.
REV-21-3197

image960×960 58 KB

Another option could be to use our new REV-21-3199 bearing sized for #10 screws:

image960×960 52.2 KB

This would enable you to use the 10-32 tapped hole on the end of the gear and have the screw serve as the axle for the end support.

REV Robotics

ION Bearings

REV Robotics designs, builds and manufactures robotics parts and components used by students for learning about science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM). Our parts are commonly used within the FIRST Robotics Competition and the FIRST Tech...

Price: USD 4.5

Ok, thanks.

Note i don’t really want additional support, I’m really wondering if i need additional support. I imagine you-all have done some analysis of the failures that have been reported, so, what did you learn? What should I know?
